intro: Adhatoda congrua, commonly known as Indian snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters, featuring opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly rough texture. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are usually pale blue or violet in color, arranged in clusters at the ends of the branches. Its root system is fibrous and has been traditionally used in Ayurvedic medicine for its purported medicinal properties. The plant thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils.
